content.description: An owner of a novelty business operates both an online store and a retail store. The owner took a random sample of <math alttext="50" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>50</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> sales from each store during the past year and recorded the purchase amount of each sale. Summary statistics are shown in the following table.
content.question: Online Retail <math alttext="n" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>n</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="50" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>50</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="50" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>50</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> Mean <math alttext="$42.80" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>$</mtext><mn>42.80</mn></math> <math alttext="$27.50" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>$</mtext><mn>27.50</mn></math> Standard deviation <math alttext="$10.50" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>$</mi><mn>10.50</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="$8.25" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>$</mtext><mn>8.25</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> Assuming the conditions for inference were met, the owner calculated a <math alttext="95" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>95</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> percent confidence interval for the difference in mean purchase amounts (online minus retail) as <math alttext="open parenthesis, $11.55 comma $19.05, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mrow><mtext>$</mtext><mn>11.55</mn></mrow><mo>,</mo><mrow><mtext>$</mtext><mn>19.05</mn></mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following is an appropriate interpretation of the <math alttext="95" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>95</mn></math> percent confidence interval?

choices.label: We are <math alttext="95%" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>95</mn><mo>%</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> confident that the purchase amount from a randomly selected online store sale will be between <math alttext="$11.55" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>$</mtext><mn>11.55</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="$19.05" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>$19.05</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> greater than the purchase amount from a randomly selected retail store sale.

We are <math alttext="95%" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>95</mn><mo>%</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> confident that the sample mean purchase amount from the online store is between <math alttext="$11.55" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>$</mtext><mn>11.55</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="$19.05" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>$19.05</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> greater than the sample mean purchase amount from the retail store for the past year.

We are <math alttext="95%" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>95</mn><mo>%</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> confident that the population mean purchase amount from the online store is between <math alttext="$11.55" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>$</mtext><mn>11.55</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="$19.05" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>$19.05</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> greater than the population mean purchase amount from the retail store for the past year.

We are <math alttext="95%" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>95</mn><mo>%</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> confident that the population mean purchase amount for the past year from both stores combined is between <math alttext="$11.55" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>$</mtext><mn>11.55</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="$19.05" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>$</mtext><mtext>19.05</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>.

We are <math alttext="95%" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>95</mn><mo>%</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> confident that if new samples of the same size were taken from each store, the sample mean purchase amount from the online store would be between <math alttext="$11.55" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>$</mi><mtext>11.55</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="$19.05" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>$19.05</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> greater than the sample mean purchase amount from the retail store.

content.answer: We are <math alttext="95%" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>95</mn><mo>%</mo></mrow></mstyle></math> confident that the population mean purchase amount from the online store is between <math alttext="$11.55" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>$</mtext><mn>11.55</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="$19.05" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>$19.05</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> greater than the population mean purchase amount from the retail store for the past year.

topic.text: 7.7: Justifying a Claim About the Difference of Two Means Based on a Confidence Interval

skill.text: Skill 4.B: Interpret statistical calculations and findings to assign meaning or assess a claim.
